text.0: associate with fires make your god agni envoy at sacrifice best skilled in worship.
text.1: established firm among mankind the holy flamecrowned and fed with oil the purifier.
text.2: like a steed neighing eager for the pasture when he hath stepped forth from the great enclosure.
text.3: then the wind following blows upon his splendour and straight the path is black which thou hast travelled.
text.4: from thee a bull but newly born o agni the kindled everlasting flames rise upward.
text.5: aloft to heaven thy ruddy smoke ascendeth agni thou speedest to the gods as envoy.
text.6: thou whose fresh lustre oer the earth advanceth when greedily with thy jaws thy food thou eatest.
text.7: like a host hurried onward comes thy lasso fierce with thy tongue thou piercest as twere barley.
text.8: the men have decked him both at eve and morning most youthful agni as they tend a courser.
text.9: they kindle him a guest within his dwelling bright shines the splendour of the worshipped hero.
text.10: o fair of face beautiful is thine aspect when very near at hand like gold thou gleamest.
text.11: like heavens thundering roar thy might approaches and like the wondrous sun thy light thou showest.
text.12: that we may worship with your hail to agni with sacrificial cakes and fat oblations.
text.13: guard us o agni with those boundless glories as with a hundred fortresses of iron.
text.14: thine are resistless songs for him who offers and herogiving hymns wherewith thou savest.
text.15: with these o son of strength o jātavedas guard us preserve these princes and the singers.
text.16: when forth he cometh like an axe newsharpened pure in his form resplendent in his body.
text.17: sprung sought with eager longing from his parents for the gods worship sage and purifier.
text.18: shine this felicity on us o agni may we attain to perfect understanding.
text.19: all happiness be theirs who sing and praise thee ye gods preserve us evermore with blessings.
